Title:
Cladogenesis of the Enoplognatha ovata group (Araneae,
Theridiidae), with description of a new Mediterranean species.
Abstract:
In addition to Enoplognatha ovata (Clerck), E. latimana
Hippa & Oksala and E. penelope Hippa & Oksala, the E. ovata
group is considered to include the species E. margarita Yaginuma and E.
afrodite sp. n.Â The group is concluded to form one phyletic clade on the
evidence of the synapomorphic similarity in the general body structure
and colour pattern. The sequence of the sister species and groups is
considered to be: ovata and latimana, penelope, margarita, afrodite. E.
afrodite sp. n., widespread in the Mediterranean region, is
distinguished by the submedian, not subapical, metatarsal
trichobothrium. A redescription is given of the male palp and female
epigyne and vulva of E. margarita. Index words: Enoplognatha ovata
group, Araneae, Theridiidae, taxonomy, cladogenesis.
